summary: This is a brief email from July 11, 2019, regarding the case US v Epstein. The sender asks the Government if it assents to a motion to seal any submission of Jeffrey Epstein's financial information to Judge Berman. The email is from someone named Marty and contains a standard legal confidentiality notice.

persons.name: Marty
persons.context: Appears to be the sender of the email, inquiring about the Government's position on sealing Jeffrey Epstein's financial information.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case (US v Epstein) whose financial information is the topic of the sealing motion inquiry.

persons.name: Judge Berman
persons.context: The judge to whom Epstein's financial information would be submitted, as referenced in the email.

connections.description: Marty is inquiring about a legal procedure (motion to seal) concerning Epstein's financial information, suggesting a legal or representational connection.
Judge Berman is the presiding judge in the case US v Epstein, as indicated by the reference to submitting financial information to him.

events.title: Email regarding motion to seal financial info
events.description: An email is sent inquiring whether the Government assents to a motion to seal any submission of Jeffrey Epstein's financial information to Judge Berman.

keyFacts: On July 11, 2019, a legal inquiry was made about sealing Jeffrey Epstein's financial information in the case US v Epstein.
The inquiry was directed to the Government, asking if it assented to a motion to seal submissions to Judge Berman.
The document highlights ongoing legal procedures concerning the confidentiality of Epstein's financial records during the prosecution.
